ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Don't bother trying to get in this class if you are not a senior or junior film studies major.

Take it! Professor Trachtenberg is wonderful and knows a lot about film. He's at his best when you watch clips of the films and listen to him analyze them as they run â he has such thoughtful and interesting observations. And all of the movies are terrific, so it's all very fun.
Pretty chill- material is really cool. I mean, you can't really beat watching a gritty gangster movie every week.

I loved the course. You get to watch amazing movies and then talk about them. Professor Trachtenberg is a really nice man and you would enjoy his seminar a lot. And I learned so much too! So I definitely recommend it.

A fantastic course in a very interesting subject. The movies and books are all legitimately enjoyable, and you will be glad to have watched them. The seminar runs well, and the professor is great. I would recommend this highly.
An introduction to the film noir genre - films of the 40s and 50s - from Double Indemnity to Touch of Evil. Take it!

I would definitely recommend this class to a fellow student. The films are great, you learn about what America was like during the film noir era, and the class is overall enjoyable. The workload is very manageable as well.
